item.title: Links and updates
item.description: Programming C is Not a Low-level Language All programming languages are abstractions, in some way. Even simplistic ones, like C and x86 assembly, are now quite far from the bare bones of the hardware (at least, in the x86-world) – there’s just too many layers of intermediate translations and optimizations that the CPU does by itself. RISC architectures are better in that regard, as even x86 CPUs are RISC-like internally nowadays (or so they say), so at least it’s more transparent that way.
